page.title: 08DAMHEAD
page.content: Damhead is a hill farm of one hundred and sixty acres. It has been farmed by the Robson family for twelve years and is a rented farm belonging to the Charteris family. The farm is mixed with one hundred sheep (grey and black faced), one hundred and twenty beef cattle (Hereford,Fresian, Charolais, Limousin), and cereals. The excess sheep and cattle are sold at Lockerbie market. The cereal crop grown is barley. Some of this is kept for winter feeding, the surplis again being sold. Much of the farmland is used for either grazing or the growing of grass for silage (winter feeding). The farm also has eleven hens which provide eggs for the family. (CONT.)
